title: How to Build a Vertical Garden from Soda Bottles

steps.title: Cut around the base of one soda bottle.
steps.content: Cut around the base of one soda bottle. Make the cut a bit below where the label ends, ideally so that a tiny bit of the bottom curve inward is preserved. This will help the bottles nest tightly together when you stack them. Discard base of bottle

steps.title: Poke two drainage holes with scissors, on opposite sides, about three inches above the cap.
steps.content: Poke two drainage holes with scissors, on opposite sides, about three inches above the cap. How big? No bigger than the diameter of a Bic pen. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Fill the bottle with potting mix, compost or garden soil, pressing the soil in lightly.
steps.content: Fill the bottle with potting mix, compost or garden soil, pressing the soil in lightly. Leave an inch of space at the top of the bottle.

steps.title: Tie the base for your tower onto a supporting structure, such as chain-link fencing or wire, with twine.
steps.content: Tie the base for your tower onto a supporting structure, such as chain-link fencing or wire, with twine. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Cut the bottom off a bottle, just as you did to create the base.
steps.content: Cut the bottom off a bottle, just as you did to create the base. Remove the cap and discard.

steps.title: Fill the bottle gently with soil, as for the base, reserving one inch of space at the top.
steps.content: Fill the bottle gently with soil, as for the base, reserving one inch of space at the top.

steps.title: Nest the bottle firmly atop the base, and tie it on.
steps.content: Nest the bottle firmly atop the base, and tie it on.

steps.title: Repeat this part 1-3 times, depending on how tall you want your tower to be.
steps.content: Repeat this part 1-3 times, depending on how tall you want your tower to be.

steps.title: Cut a bottle in half about midway toward the top.
steps.content: Cut a bottle in half about midway toward the top. This bottle will be shorter than the others, and will serve as a funnel for watering.

steps.title: Cut the bottom off a final bottle, just as you did for the base and tower levels.
steps.content: Cut the bottom off a final bottle, just as you did for the base and tower levels. This will be the watering bottle.

steps.title: Drill a one mm hole in the cap, or pierce with a nail, and replace cap.
steps.content: Drill a one mm hole in the cap, or pierce with a nail, and replace cap.

steps.title: Place the funnel atop the tower, nesting it firmly in the soil of the level below.
steps.content: Place the funnel atop the tower, nesting it firmly in the soil of the level below.

steps.title: Place the watering bottle atop the funnel, and (optionally) tie down.
steps.content: Place the watering bottle atop the funnel, and (optionally) tie down.

steps.title: Cut three lines in each soil bottle with a box cutter, as if you were drawing the top and sides of a square.
steps.content: Cut three lines in each soil bottle with a box cutter, as if you were drawing the top and sides of a square. (Each side of the square should be about 1.5-2 inches.) Leave the bottom of the square uncut, and instead fold down the flap. This creates a valve to hold the soil and seedling in. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Poke a hole, and insert a small seedling or seeds.
steps.content: Poke a hole, and insert a small seedling or seeds.

steps.title: Fill the watering bottle every few days, as needed.
steps.content: Fill the watering bottle every few days, as needed.
